CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 27, reads: "Shadyside Hospital Rummage Sale - All day Friday, Oct. 21, from 9 A. M. to 9 P. M., the giant rummage sale at Shadyside Hospital Auditorium will be in full swing. Here student nurse Vina Crable and Mrs. Thomas Hilliard of the class of 1957 look over a portion of the thousands of dresses and suits, many in superb condition or brank new, as well as every conceivable object from furs to furbelows...and furniture which will go for ridiculous prices.  Mrs. Henry Blaxter of ahe [the] ladies committee, Mrs. Thomas Hilliard of the social service board, and Mrs. Regis Wolfe, who is co-chairman of curtains and draperies, are in charge of plans for the sale. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Thomas Hilliard and nurse Vina Crable holding clothing in Shadyside Hospital, vertical format
